title: Here is a list of 20 articles up to 2023 that focus on mistake correction in large language models
**"Fine-Tuning Language Models from Human Preferences"**
**"Learning to Summarize with Human Feedback"**
**"Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"**
**"Improving Language Understanding by Generative Pre-Training"** - Radford et al
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** - Devlin et al
**"RoBERTa: A Robustly Optimized BERT Pretraining Approach"** - Liu et al
**"T5: Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"**
**"DistilBERT, a distilled version of BERT: smaller, faster, cheaper and lighter"**
**"CTRL: A Conditional Transformer Language Model for Controllable Generation"** - Keskar et al
**"XLNet: Generalized Autoregressive Pretraining for Language Understanding"** - Yang et al
Pre-training Text Encoders as Discriminators Rather Than Generators"**
**"GPT-3: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"**
**"Analyzing and Reducing the Performance Gap in Cross-Lingual Transfer with Fine-Tuning Slow and Fast"**
**"Reformer: The Efficient Transformer"** - Kitaev et al
**"DeBERTa: Decoding-enhanced BERT with Disentangled Attention"** - He et al
**"Improving Language Models by Retrieving from Trillions of Tokens"** - Borgeaud et al
**"Scaling Laws for Neural Language Models"** - Kaplan et al
**"Training Language Models to Follow Instructions with Human Feedback"**
**"InstructGPT: Aligning Language Models to Follow Instructions"**
**"Evaluating Large Language Models Trained on Code"** - Chen et al

These articles cover a range of topics related to the development, fine-tuning, and error correction of large language models, providing a comprehensive overview of the state-of-the-art techniques and methodologies up to
